title: doc: specify required GLIBC version for binary downloads
body:
by **r.w.johnstone**: 
I cannot build packages using the binary distribution of Go for linux.  The go tool runs
fine.  Running 'go version' results in:

go version go1

However, 'go build' results in the following error:

/data/home/johnstor/usr/go/pkg/tool/linux_386/8g: /lib/tls/libc.so.6: version
`GLIBC_2.4' not found (required by /data/home/johnstor/usr/go/pkg/tool/linux_386/8g)
/data/home/johnstor/usr/go/pkg/tool/linux_386/8g: /lib/tls/libc.so.6: version
`GLIBC_2.7' not found (required by /data/home/johnstor/usr/go/pkg/tool/linux_386/8g)

The following tools located in the tool directory fail with the same error: 8a, 8c, 8g,
8l, addr2line.
